meanings.definition: To rent out (a property) to someone.
meanings.sent1: I will overlet my apartment to a friend while I am on vacation.
meanings.sent2: She decided to overlet her house to a young couple looking for a place to stay.
meanings.sent3: The landlord accidentally overlet the same apartment to two different tenants!
meanings.sent4: His generosity in overletting his cabin to those in need warmed everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: Overletting your property can be a great way to earn extra income.

meanings.sent1: The cozy cottage by the lake was an overlet for the summer season.
meanings.sent2: They found the perfect overlet for their family vacation in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The overlet they booked online turned out to be much smaller than expected.
meanings.sent4: The overlet felt like a home away from home during their holiday.
meanings.sent5: The overlet's stunning view of the ocean made their stay unforgettable.
